rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment provides factual context on egg production and chicken population without using high-potency language.
The segment uses plain verbs ('is', 'had') and mentions inventory, not impact scale from the disease.
The segment does not contain any questions.
This segment reports state status and inventory figures but contains no explicit calming language or cues.
The segment does not contain a minimiser token ('only', 'just', etc.) combined with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes agricultural production volume, not capabilities or preparedness related to the threat.
'had 46 million chickens on farms' reports a population number using a standard verb.
